Entries.default:
"Thought I'd locked that thing."

The glassy-eyed gentleman before you bears the miserable expression of the recently sober. He also smells like he's been pickling in a cask for a few days.
"Help a fellow out, would you? I think we're running low."
"That you, Rix? ...Shit, I'm drunker than I thought."
"Not this again. How do I put this politely? Piss off."
"I'm on the next ship out of here. Unless you're here to kick me off the docks this time."

"Baru!" 

Galian takes a half-step towards his companion, his expression anguished.
"Ugh. That one hurt."
"Try not to slam the door on your way out, yeah? My head's going to pieces."
"This place is a mess."

"Now, that's not nice. Things were real comfortable up until you turned up." 

He nudges an empty bottle with a boot.
"Thorel wants you out of here."
"I'm here for the rent."

"Is old Thorel hiring right out of the villages, now? You know your liquor from your ale, big man?"

"Doesn't matter. We're out of both."
Entries.female:
"Is old Thorel hiring right out of the villages, now? You know your liquor from your ale, big girl?"

"Doesn't matter. We're out of both."

Entries.default: "It's been a hard week for all of us. Truth is, I've been seeing something like... three of you for a while now, okay? It's all... it's all very fuzzy."
[Leave] "Farewell."
"Blazes. I was going to say you wandered into the wrong room, but by the look of things it runs in the family."
"Does he now? And what are you supposed to do about it?"
"You can leave on your feet or get dragged out by the ankles. Your choice."
"You really want the guards in here to throw you out into the street?"

"The governor's got all his guards on high alert, staving off the pirates." 

He waggles a hand in a gesture of mock alarm.
"I'm asking politely."
"Thorel said I could get rough if I had to."
"Maybe we could share the room. I could settle your tab."

"Oh, aye? You running Thorel's errands?

Well, I haven't got his pay, and he knows it. Come back tomorrow. Better yet, tell him I'll swing by myself when I do have it."

"You've got the wrong room. I know you company men like to wander in and plant the flag anywhere you please, but kindly wander back out again."

He makes a mocking sweep of the arm, and nearly unbalances himself.
Entries.female:
"You've got the wrong room. I know you company ladies like to wander in and wave the flag anywhere you please, but kindly wander back out again."

He makes a mocking sweep of the arm, and nearly unbalances himself.

Entries.default: "Thing is, the way doors work, right - and I realize this is complicated - is that you close them, and then uninvited people stay on the other side."
[Leave] "I'll be back."
"What? No! It's bad enough in here with the lot of us. Find your own hole to crawl into. This one's mine. Ours. Whatever."
"I thought I'd help out with your headache. By screaming very loudly."
"...What?"
"I can do this all day."

Galian cringes, grimacing, as you start to scream. He claps his hands over his ears, doubling over.

Multiple distressed protests issue from his companions, all muffled by your caterwauling.
"Hylea's tits, what're you doing that for?!"
"You've got until I count to ten to get your things and get out."

Galian blinks at you and then at his companions. 

He bursts into laughter.
"Did Thorel put you up to this? You really want to get your teeth kicked in on his behalf? Get out of here before you regret it."
"You're the one offed Thorel? What'd you go and do that for?"

"So if anyone's going to be doing the throwing, it's going to have to be you."

"How about it, tough guy?" 

He reaches out to give you a shove.
Entries.female:
"So if anyone's going to be doing the throwing, it's going to have to be you."

"How about it, mate?" 

He reaches out to give you a shove.

Entries.default: "I don't think you realize how much of a nuisance i can be."
"I do a great falsetto."
Galian waves dismissively, shaking his head.

"This has been real fun, but I think I've had enough of you now."

He straightens up, wobbling slightly on his feet, and brings up his fists.
Beside him, a stocky aumaua woman does a much less showy job of settling into a ready stance.
[Punch him in the nose.]
[Step aside.]
"Don't."
"You're trying to kick us out! Nothing polite about that."
"Thorel's pretty steamed. Things are only going to get worse."
[Give him 100cp] "Here. Find another tavern."
"There must be other taverns."
"Can't you just pay what you owe?"
"Clean yourself up and ask around the docks. Someone's bound to have work for you."

Galian sneers for a moment, but something in your expression squelches his confidence in a hurry.

He scratches nervously at his beard.
"All right. All right, just... keep your boots on. We're leaving. Thorel wants us out on the street so bad, so be it."

"You serious, Galian? Where are we supposed to go?"

The aumaua woman glowers at you before following him out.

"You might have noticed, but the town's a little crowded. We're not the only ones whose ship got smashed to pieces." 

"My Peregrine, down at the bottom of the harbor. May she rest." He briefly doffs his hat.

Galian looks down at the coin in his hands, then aims a suspicious look up at you. 

It doesn't last long. He shrugs, and pockets the money.

"Yeah, I guess that'll do. If it means so much to you."

"...Come on, you lot. Let's clear out."

"Of course I can! I'm just... In a spot of trouble at the moment.

We came here to trade. And then our fortunes sank to the bottom of the harbor, along with my ship. What am I supposed to do?"

Galian looks down at himself, and then out at the fouled bedding and the sticky carpets. 

His shoulders slump.

"Thorel's got a heart of stone, he has. A man loses everything, and he can't even drown his sorrows for a while? 

These are ex... external..."
"Extenuating."

"Difficult circumspects for all of us, all right?" 

He pats himself down for a flask, which he produces from the depths of his soiled shirt.
"You serious? You're going to let him kick us out of our own room?"
Entries.female: "You serious? You're going to let her kick us out of our own room?"

Entries.default: "Well... maybe we did lose our heads a little."

"Come on, you lot. The crew of the Peregrine sails for brighter shores." 

He heads out at a wobbling limp.
"Never mind."
"Just leave off, will you? Every time you open your mouth it's like a little knife behind the eyes."
[Attack.] "Your mistake."
"Just get out of here."

"Come on, you lot! We're leaving."

He stumbles past you, and raises an arm to motion his compatriots onward.
[Take the punch.]

You hear the sharp crack of joints as Galian's fist impacts somewhat clumsily with your sternum. 

Galian immediately tucks his curled fist against his stomach, wincing.

"Have to admit... I was aiming for your face." 

He gazes up at you, wide-eyed.
[Shove him back.]
[Stab him in the arm.]
"Feeling better about yourself?"

Galian's punch goes more than a little wide, and he stumbles past you.

He stops there, doubles over, and promptly retches an impressive volume of alcohol.

Galian rocks back, clutching at his bloodied nose. 

He groans piteously from the floor.
His aumaua compatriot shakes her head.

"Ugh... Yeah, okay, I'm... I'm done."

He holds up a hand to ward off further hostility.
He scowls at you, but the less than impressive exchange of blows leaves him standing awkwardly.
"You finished?"

"Ahh! Shit-" 

Galian clutches at his wound. His face pales as blood seeps between his fingers. He gapes at you, open-mouthed.
"What is wrong with - All right, all right, we're leaving!"
Galian aims a sullen glower in the general direction of his boots.

"Okay, look. We're done, all right?" 

He drops his weapon, presenting his empty palms.
"Don't remember ordering more drinks..."
"Faster, you lot. Let's get off this rock."
"Don't test me. I can take this up to a shriek."

"No! No, no need for that. Just stop." 

He raises his hand in a placating gesture, still wincing.
"For fun, mostly."
Galian gives a low, aggravated groan.
